title: Measurement Conversions
description: How well do you know common measurement conversions?

questions.question: How many cups are in one quart?
questions.explanation: There are 4 cups in one quart. A quart is also equal to 2 pints or 32 fluid ounces.

questions.question: How many feet are in one mile?
questions.explanation: There are 5,280 feet in one mile. This number dates back to an act of the English Parliament in 1593.

questions.question: How many inches are in one foot?
questions.explanation: There are 12 inches in one foot. This measurement has been used since ancient times.

questions.question: How many tablespoons are in one cup?
questions.explanation: There are 16 tablespoons in one cup. Each tablespoon equals 3 teaspoons, so there are 48 teaspoons in a cup.

questions.question: How many ounces are in one pound?
questions.explanation: There are 16 ounces in one pound. This is the avoirdupois pound used in the United States and other countries.

questions.question: Approximately how many kilometers equal one mile?
questions.explanation: One mile equals approximately 1.609 kilometers. Conversely, one kilometer is about 0.621 miles.

questions.question: How many pints are in one gallon?
questions.explanation: There are 8 pints in one gallon. A gallon has 4 quarts, and each quart has 2 pints.

questions.question: What temperature in Fahrenheit equals 0 degrees Celsius?
questions.explanation: 0°C equals 32°F, the freezing point of water. The formula is F = (C x 9/5) + 32.

questions.question: How many centimeters are in one inch?
questions.explanation: One inch equals exactly 2.54 centimeters. This conversion factor was officially adopted internationally in 1959.

questions.question: How many yards are in one mile?
questions.explanation: There are 1,760 yards in one mile. Since one yard is 3 feet: 5,280 feet / 3 = 1,760 yards.

questions.question: How many grams are in one troy ounce, used for precious metals?
questions.explanation: One troy ounce equals approximately 31.10 grams. This is different from the standard avoirdupois ounce (28.35 grams) and is used for gold and silver.

questions.question: How many liters are in one U.S. gallon?
questions.explanation: One U.S. gallon equals approximately 3.785 liters. Note that an Imperial (UK) gallon is larger at about 4.546 liters.

questions.question: Approximately how many acres are in one square mile?
questions.explanation: There are exactly 640 acres in one square mile. An acre was historically defined as the area a team of oxen could plow in one day.

questions.question: What temperature is the same in both Fahrenheit and Celsius?
questions.explanation: -40 degrees is the same in both Fahrenheit and Celsius. This can be proven by the formula: F = (C x 9/5) + 32; when C = -40, F = -40.

questions.question: How many nautical miles equal one degree of latitude?
questions.explanation: One degree of latitude equals approximately 60 nautical miles. A nautical mile is about 1.151 standard miles or 1.852 kilometers.
